result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven F. Brennand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:23 a.m. Defendant Steven F. Brennand in court.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig states agreement proposed in August - Defendant states has had AODA assessment - wishes to proceed on own - waiver free and voluntary -  Defendant enters no contest plea. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Defendant questions return of firearm - Court states defendant is not prohibited from possessing firearms - probation may have other requirements.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 1 year
CC/DNA surcharge/Supervision fees
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
ADOA Assessment and follow-through
Any counseling/conditions deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given

Adj. 11:36 a.m.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 3:11 p.m. Defendant Steven F. Brennand in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant re attorney.  Defendant files Petition for court appointed attorney - Court denies petition. Adj. 3:17 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
no intoxicants in any amount in any location, no taverns, may not possess any firearms

02:21 pm - Defendant Steven F. Brennand in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel.  MIchlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
